title: search: guard user from misspecification of search query
body:
E.g. we use `:` as a separate in the search query in `key:value`.  Since it is more conventional to specify `key=value` it is easy to make that "mistake" here and  simply obtain no results - not even a warning issued.

Example:
```
(git-annex)hopa:~/datalad[master]
$> datalad -c datalad.search.index-egrep-documenttype=all search bids.MagneticFieldStrength=3T           
[INFO   ] no hits 
datalad -c datalad.search.index-egrep-documenttype=all search   76.81s user 1.99s system 96% cpu 1:21.26 total
```
with the correct one being:
```
$> datalad -c datalad.search.index-egrep-documenttype=all search bids.MagneticFieldStrength:3T | head
search(ok): /home/yoh/datalad/openfmri/ds000217/derivatives/mriqc/reports/sub-Exp1s01_task-routelearning_run-01_bold.html (file)
search(ok): /home/yoh/datalad/openfmri/ds000217/derivatives/mriqc/reports/sub-Exp1s01_task-routelearning_run-02_bold.html (file)
search(ok): /home/yoh/datalad/openfmri/ds000217/derivatives/mriqc/reports/sub-Exp1s01_task-routelearning_run-03_bold.html (file)
search(ok): /home/yoh/datalad/openfmri/ds000217/derivatives/mriqc/reports/sub-Exp1s01_task-routelearning_run-04_bold.html (file)
search(ok): /home/yoh/datalad/openfmri/ds000217/derivatives/mriqc/reports/sub-Exp1s01_task-routelearning_run-05_bold.html (file)
...
```
in this particular case I would even expect `search` just error out since IMHO it was entirely incorrect specification.  If we were to look for hits where that field is present with any value, it should have been `field:.*`
